@StinkStopthe 15/5 06.30 sleepless night yet again. Horrendous stench emanating from Walleys landfill engulfed my home and surrounding streets. Totally unacceptable @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids incident logged with a pathetic generic reply received. Shame on you.

"The site has been breached for discharges from storm tanks during non-storm conditions."

In English. Berkhamsted STW is operating illegally by dumping sewage into the River Bulbourne, a chalk stream, 1 of only 225 in the entire world.

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG
@EllieChowns @EnvAgency That looks a lot like horse manure. Shavings and hay.

urls.title: Bathing Water Quality
urls.description: Bathing waters are key locations at a beach where the highest number of people swim and paddle. The water quality is tested regularly in the summer months (May to September) at these designated areas by the Environment Agency to check on the levels of harmful bacteria and other pollutants in the water. Tests are carried out at 25 bathing waters in Dorset and 8 bathing waters in East Devon. The bathing water quality is classified using the Revised Bathing Water Directive based on the amount bacteria in
